alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; King and Queen; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 2:44PM EDT until August 10 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Gloucester County in southeastern Virginia... Southwestern Middlesex County in eastern Virginia... Southeastern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 244 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shacklefords, or near West Point, and is drifting east to southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Urbanna, Glenns and Saluda around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Warner, Pampa, Mascot, Remlik, Healys, Adner, Gressit, Clancie, Cooper and Velma. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
